body: Perform immunohistochemistry for chemokine receptors CXCR1, CXCR3 and CXCR4 on first trimester human placental paraffin-embedded sections as previously described \[1], with microwave antigen retrieval using sodium citrate buffer \(Zymed Laboratory Inc, San- Francisco, CA, USA).
Stain with the same concentration of isotype match controls for each chemokine receptor on the same serial sections as controls.
Perform immunohistochemistry on decidual sections with NCR-Fc fusion proteins \(prepared as previously described
by microwave heating the formalin-fixed, paraffin embedded tissue sections in citrate buffer in order to retrieve antigens.
Then stain sections with the different NCR-Fc fusion proteins or control-Fc \(8 Âµg/ml, final concentration) followed by biotinylated-goat-anti-human-Fc \(Jackson ImmunoResearch, West Grove, PA).
Detect using the avidin-biotin peroxidase complex method with a Vectastain kit \(Vector Laboratories, Burlingame, CA).
